payload.title: Arriving at AYT
payload.description: Antalya operates *two separate International Terminals* (T1 & T2) located 2.5km apart. They are not connected by foot, so knowing your terminal is essential.
payload.criticalAlert: If you land at **Terminal 2**, you cannot walk to the tram. You must board a taxi or the Havaş shuttle.
tips: **Terminal 1:** Follow the blue signage to the elevated walkway for the Antray tram station.
**Terminal 2:** Board the white Havaş shuttle or a taxi; there is no direct tram access here.
**Official Taxis:** Use only the managed outdoor stands. Ignore 'private' offers inside the terminal.
**Payment:** Most taxis accept contactless cards; confirm with the driver before departing.

payload.title: Money & Payments
payload.description: Antalya is highly digital, but street markets and local transit still run on the Turkish Lira.
payload.criticalAlert: Avoid **Euronet ATMs** (blue/yellow kiosks); they charge predatory conversion fees up to 15%.
tips: **Currency:** Always select **TRY** on card terminals to ensure your own bank handles the exchange.
**Small Cash:** Keep 20₺ or 50₺ notes for the Dolmuş minibuses and public restrooms.
**Bank ATMs:** Use PTT or Ziraat for the lowest fees and official exchange rates.
